oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Selected Biochemical Parameters for Estimation of Energy Metabolism in Dual Purpose Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bouda, Jan
Candanosa-de Morales, Eugenia
Quiroz-Rocha, Gerardo F.
Paasch-Mart√≠nez, Leopoldo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: biochemical parameters
energy status
metabolic disorders
milk production
infertility
Holstein
Cebu
mineral supplementation
molasses supplementation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is important to measure selected biochemical parameters in the body fluids to estimate the energy status and relate it with metabolic disorders, milk production and infertility. In 10 cows (F1 Holstein x Cebu) on grazing conditions with mineral and molasses supplementation, samplings were done during the following periods: 2-3 weeks prepartum, 3 weeks, 2, 3, 4 and 7 months postpartum. In each period physical examinations of animals, milk yield and body condition were registered.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 293-294
